awd_titl_txt: Oceanic Carbon Cycle Model Analysis of a New Global Data Set of Oceanic Carbon Including Extensive 13C Data and         Supporting Measurements
awd_abstract_narration: ABSTRACT    As  part of the Synthesis and Modeling Project of the U.S.  Joint  Global  Ocean  Flux  Study (U.S.JGOFS), this research  team  will  compile  data on the global distribution in seawater of dissolved  inorganic  carbon  and  the ratio of two carbon  stable  isotopes  (13C/12C)  to construct several models of oceanic carbon  cycling  and  sea-air exchange of carbon dioxide.  The data will be  drawn  from  the 20-year dataset collected by the Scripps Carbon Dioxide  Research Group and from other major ocean programs with a  carbon  dioxide  component, especially U.S.JGOFS and  WOCE  (World  Ocean  Circulation Experiment).  Such studies will allow estimates to be  made  of  the  oceanic  capacity to take up anthropogenic  carbon  dioxide  from the atmosphere.  They are expected to  improve  our  current ability to project global carbon dioxide trends into  the  next century.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
